lines.text: Garbaldo, I told you to keep this ship steady.
It is steady, sir.
Are you contradicting me?
Sorry sir, you're right, there's a strong wind coming from the... northeast.
I don't care where it's from, stop it!
Violence is the sign language of the inarticulate.
Hey, look man, I don't know what this is all about, but I've dropped out of your gadget civilization. I've renounced all science and technocracy.

[after taking LSD]
I'm an angel! I'm a goddamn angel! Hallelujah!
Man, how I wish I could be nothin'.
What?
Nothin'.
Noth-ing.
If you can't dig nothin' you can't dig anything. You dig?
You mean if I could be nothing, I would be everything?

You dig! I mean like that's why the stablishment cats are not makin' it. They're diggin' the 9 to 5 bag. Rush to the city. What's happening' in the news instead of what's happenin' in themselves. You dig?
Now I see what you mean. Everything we need is right here inside ourselves.
Hey, you dig! I mean like the vibrations are there, dewdrop. You know I really think we could make it, you and I. I really feel we could make it.

[after taking LSD]
Hey. Hey, you look like a flower.
That's funny. I feel like a flower!

[smoking marijuana]
Mmm, pumpkin!

[singing]
Skidoo! Skidoo! Between a one and three, there is a two!

[referring to LSD]
Hey, maybe if I took some of that stuff... I wouldn't have to rape anybody no more!
Why don't I go out, you ask? There are nine guys on my crew. You know what the odds are on one of them trying to bump me off?
Yeah, nine to one.
And you think those are good odds, ay?
Do you have a-ny chil-dren?
[the men press their buttons, but the Professor looks puzzled]
Someone hasn't pressed his but-ton! Someone hasn't pressed his but-ton!
What's the idea here, buddy?
These machines are silly!
What's the big deal? You just press "yes" or "no".
Yes, but suppose my answer is "maybe"...
The results of our anti-ugliness drive were less than satisfactory.
Soufflé! Soufflé!
I see the Green Bay Packers... and they're all naked!

[stoned on acid]
The prisoners can get together and make costume jewelry, design their own uniforms, decorate their own cells...
The only three great Americans are Washington, Lincoln... and me!

[referring to a hot-air balloon while tripping on LSD]
Do you see what I see?
It's a balloon.
No. It's a great, big, beautiful blob of nothing. It wants me. It wants me. It loves me.
Yeah!
But why is it going away?
I see it. I see it! Yeah.
Yeah.
Yeah-da-da yeah-da-da.
Tony, it looks like one of them hippies!
That's right... and no hippie is gonna make it with my daughter.
Daddy, he wasn't going to... I'm not sure *he* even knows what he wants.
What is he, a faggot?

[at the end]
Stop! We are not through! And before you skidoo, we'd like to introduce our cast and crew.
[Harry Nilsson sings the closing credits]
For family fun, get your gun!

[hallucinating on LSD]
Mathematics! I see mathematics! She's got my ears! She's got my ears! She's got my ears!
Listen, "God" sent for your father.

[wails, horrified, thinking Tony has died]
Nooooo!

[a little annoyed]
Not THAT God, dope.

[unbuttons her jacket]
Right now, I'd rather be doing what he's doing than what I'm doing.
You're acting rashly.
I'm not acting rashly.
Find yourself in the water.
You're bendin' the velvet!
I wanna see God!
Geronimo, this is Darlene.
Hello.
This is Iris, and various assorted beautiful people.
I'm sorry if I spoiled anything.
Nah. She was just trying to sell me a set of encyclopedias.
I'm a recidivist.
What's that?
Habitual criminal. Been comin' here on and off since '51.
The only kid in the cell block with his own personal stationery.
So this is Tony's girl, huh? Little Kiss-Kiss herself.
What do you mean?
You and that Commanche looked like you were never coming up for air.
We passed in the night. Last night. I can still close my eyes and see you.
Where do you get your dialogue from, old Valentines?
Where is my father? Do you know?
Baby, I know so much it's painful.
Are you here, sweetheart? Open the door and be glad, baby.
You're bendin' the velvet.
You're cute.
I know.
You know what, I bet you're a good dancer.
I'm a good everything.
Prove it.
Relax. Relax. I'm very good at this.
Password?
It's me! I forgot it.

[answers phone]
Worldwide Pot and Compound Festival. Make love, not war.
Speak softly.
Xerox me, man. I don't wanna be misquoted.
Peace! You were saying?

Dig the, uh, Spirit of St. Louis, man. Yeah, like, uh, Greeley says, what's seven or eight Dukes of Windsor when it's uh Mona Lisa time, huh? Yeah, take a bow and arrow, and we're not getting any younger, right? So come in X-17. Over.
Son of Norway, you're loud and clear. Cool as everything.
Over and out.
What'd he say?
Oh, he says he'll have to get back to me.
Spirit of St. Louis. Lindbergh.
Kidnapped.
Who?
Mona Lisa?
Yours.
Darlene. They've got Darlene!
Calm.
Bow and arrow. They're armed. But where?
Horace Greeley said, "Go west, young man."
He did, and how far west? Windsor...
Knots!
Water, children, water! Seven to eight knots west of... What? That's the hole. X-17. Think. X-17.
X could mean "used to be".
Seventeen! The old pier. Pier 17!

[tripping on acid]
Hey, come out here. Do you see what I see?

[looks at hot air balloon]
Scrambled eggs.
No. Jell-O. Reminds me of my wife.

[to Stash, dressed in hippie garb]
Who's your tailor, Sitting Bull?
Once more, man?
You heard me. Why do you go around dressed like that for?
Hey, we can't all be undertakers, man.

[to her father]
Stash is only interested in nothing. He isn't taken in by our false values.

[to Stash]
So how come you're drivin' a beat-up Rolls Royce? Why aren't you drivin' a beat-up Ford?
